residency and to demonstrate that the applicant is a united states citizens united states national or has lawful status as set forth in the real id act of public law driver s licenses issued pursuant to this section shall include the following driver information on each license a the person s full legal name b the person s date of birth c the person s gender d the person s driver s license or identification card number e a digital photograph of the person f the person s address of principle residence g the person s signature h physical security features designed to prevent tampering counterfeiting or duplication of the document for fraudulent purposes i a common technology with defined minimum data elements minimum issuance standards a to meet the requirements of this section the director shall require at a minimum presentation and verification of the following information before issuing a driver s license or identification card to a person a photo identity document except that a identity document shall be acceptable if it includes the person s full name and the person s date of birth documentation showing the person s date of birth proof of the person s social security account number or verification that the person is not eligible for a social security account number documentation showing the person s name and address of principle residence b prior to issuing a driver s license or identification card to a person the director shall require valid documentary evidence demonstrating that the person is a citizen of the united states is an alien lawfully admitted for permanent or temporary residence in the united states has conditional permanent resident status in the united states has an approved application for asylum in the united states or has entered the united states in refugee status has a valid unexpired nonimmigrant visa or nonimmigrant visa status for entry into the united states has a pending application for asylum in the united states has a pending or approved application for temporary protected status in the united states has approved deferred action status or has an form showing pending application for adjustment of status uscis form to that of an alien lawfully admitted for permanent residence in the united states or conditional permanent resident status in the united states c if a person presents evidence of their status pursuant to subparagraphs b the director may only issue a temporary driver s license or temporary picture identification card to the person a temporary driver s license or picture identification card issued pursuant to this subparagraph shall be valid only during the period of time the applicant is authorized to stay in the united states or if there is no definite end to the period of authorized stay for a period of one year a temporary driver s license or picture identification card issued pursuant to this subparagraph shall clearly indicate that it is temporary and shall state the date on which it expires a temporary driver s license or picture identification card issued pursuant to this subparagraph ma be renewed only upon presentation of valid documentary evidence that the status by which an applicant qualified for the temporary driver s license or picture identification card has been extended by the secretary of the department of homeland security
